I've been to them before and what differences them from regular Giant Eagle stores is that they normally have a wider selection of fresh food, a bakery department, and an area where you can purchase ready made food or a salad bar and eat inside or out.  Prices are typically higher than other grocery stores but the same as if you were looking for the same item at a regular Giant Eagle.  I normally stop here only if there's something specific I need that I cannot find at my local store. The Market District does tend to get crowded and they also offer additional services such as dry cleaning or sometimes a bank.

Parking is tough. Good food quality & pricing are fair. I don't write too many reviews but the Pharmacy department is below average. Alex C in checkout is the absolute worst!!! They call you 10 times & say your prescription is ready to get there & they say it hasn't been filled yet. We need about 20-25 minutes to fill.

Had a situation with the bakery recently. Two weeks ago dropped off artwork for half sheet cake needed for an event yesterday. Went to get cake at designated pick up time, 1 pm. Cake was nowhere to be found and it took several minutes to find our order which seemed to have been buried in a pile. Bakery team lead jumped right in apologizing for the oversight, personally decorating the cake. She had it ready in 30 minutes and took off the decorating charge. Kudos to outstanding customer service and a tasty cake that was a hit at the event.

This is my main place for groceries since it is super close to my house, so I've had a variety of experiences here.  I think the trick is to go on a Saturday when you have a lot of time and patience, or be prepared for some delays if you go after work.  I have a few gripes and a few praises, but its easiest if I list it out by category, so here it goes: Parking: Lot and parking garage (with elevator) - be prepared to fight over a spot on busy days, and wait a few minutes for an elevator if you go in the garage.  Produce: Plentiful, and usually fresh and tasty, but prices are up there with whole foods - over $1 for an apple or a tomato, and almost $3 for an avocado.   Prepared Foods: Mediocre tasting, decent variety.  Good looking salad bar as well. Associates: Knowledgeable and helpful Self Checkout/ Self Scanning:  I use both frequently and run into an issue about every other time I use either.   General Products: I must agree with Barrientos M. review, because many times things I'm looking for are expired!  They have a large selection and it includes many specialty items, but in my opinion they are not organized very well.   Store Layout: There is a reason they give you a map, this place is very confusing and large.  The specials placed in the aisles are HORRIBLE, they create backups and clusters and I've seen 'cart to heel' accidents; this place is too crowed for the layout.

God, I hate you Market District.  Most times I come here, I have to restrain myself from screaming at the top of my lungs.  But.....ala Breakfast Club John and Claire, I also love you, and I hate myself for that.  Hence, my 3-star review.  The Shadyside Market District is great in the sense that they have everything you need.  And then some.  Plus things you didn't even know you needed (buffalo flavored hummus for 6.99?  Sure!  Get in my belly.....I mean, cart).  But, whoa, it's totally over-priced.  As my mom would say "city prices".  And the parking lot is cut-throat; I recommend entering the parking garage on the Negley Side for a slightly-less congested time.  Market District does make an effort to carry local products and produce, so gotta give them props for that.   Note that only Advantage Card users can utilize the self-checkout, and you have to scan your card first before your food.

This Giant Eagle Market District is decent and has a very wide selection of foods, but it is honestly overwhelming to shop here for many reasons.  It is ALWAYS crowded - I don't care what time of day or day of the week you go - it is always insane which is great for their bottom line, but not so good for their customers who end up feeling a wee bit claustrophobic in such environments.  The store has a wide variety of ethnic foods, which are sectioned off together but if I can't remember that the red pepper flakes that I bought were from the Mexican aisle then I waste time wandering around trying to find them.  I just don't like the set up and despite how large the store is it really does feel like it closes in on you because people tend to congregate in the aisles and block your passage - it's just unpleasant.  It's also expensive - just as expensive as it's competing neighbor down the street Whole Foods.  Also, the employees are mostly just not very nice - they act like they are doing you a favor to even bag your groceries at the checkout lines and god forbid you use the self checkout because I guarantee you will wind up behind someone who knows nothing about technology or how to scan their own items or heaven forbid use a coupon at the self checkout.  You will waste a LOT of time shopping here.  Even on its worst days, the inside of Whole Foods is navigable and doesn't feel claustrophobic - it's just the parking lot that is the problem, so if I'm going to spend just as much money buying my organics and healthy food at Whole Foods as I would at the Market District, and endure snobby hipster employees versus resentful and rude employees, well, fuel points be darned, I'm going to brave the Whole Foods parking lot and shop there instead.    I gave this store 3 stars because they do have a great selection of products and now have the additional bonus of selling beer and hard cider, which is nice except for the fact (and huge hassle) that you have to pay for your alcohol in the cafe area and then you must go wait in line again to purchase your groceries - it's just not a convenient set up and I realize that is due to the PA State Liquor Laws but it is maddening and almost makes it not worth it most of the time.

There are too many sections in Giant Eagle. I wanted to give them a 4. The reason for 3, is when you go to the hot food section. Rarely does anyone want to help you, you have to ask and they seen frustrated, Just today, at around 11am. The gentlemen at the pizza bar (tall, mid 30's white male) was so helpful, so attentive. Out of the whole line of employees at the bar, he was the one attended to my order, and even gave me a sample as I waited. I ordered 6 - 8 pieces of fried chicken, which is usually sitting on the hot table outside and easily accessible. It was too early and they still did not bring that out. I want to give him a 5 star. 3 for the hot table (before him). and 4 for the overall store. I think their parking in the front needs more handicap spots. I was taking my mother to the store, and the handicap spots were almost filled. This place is crowded - indeed! However, if you are familiar with self check-out. The check out section is not so bad. It's very close to my house. I only drove because or my mother. I can walk, it's two blocks away. I love this place, it's usually very clean, long   hours. I'm one of the weird ones that likes to shop at 6am. 3 stars for the hot table, 4 stars for the over all store and parking spaces, and 5 stars for the gentlemen by the pizza bar that helped me today.
You can speak to maurice about adding brewskis to the "make your own six ~pack" if one you want isn't there! ;)

Dude, the other reviewers were NOT kidding about the parking.  I'm not a big fan of carrying orange juice up hills in the rain, but I think it would be worth it to not have to attempt to park in that insane asylum known as the giant eagle parking lot.  Giant eagle pita chips lose to Trader Joe's.  They got groceries though, lots of groceries!  I like being able to buy marketplace hummus dip AND toilet paper.  This place might beat out trader joe's for me for regular grocery trips, when I have to buy like, lettuce, and shampoo.

My last few Giant Eagle experiences haven't been promising. Surprisingly this last trip was decent. I initially made a curb side express order and was pleased to have my entire order filled without any issues or substitutions. The curb side express staff loaded my groceries into t$3 trunk rapidly.  Checked me out without issue. The curbside machine was working properly. There were no issues with running my receipt.  Additionally I had to enter the store to pick up items for a last minute recipe. Upon entering the staff was friendly and very helpful. I wasn't sure where to find several items. Staff assisted me in locating the items quickly.  I was able to get in, find my items, and check out in 15 minutes. The store was clean.    I'm happy to see improvements in the curbside process and store.
